doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Richard H. Demuth held on July 18, 1985
doc.abstracts: In July 1985, Richard H. Demuth was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert W. Oliver. During his tenure at the Bank from 1946 to 1973, Mr. Demuth worked as assistant to the president (1946) and vice president (1947-1951), and as director of both the technical assistance and liaison staff (1951-1961) and development services department (1961-1973). He remained a member of the council of the president from 1961 to 1973. His transcript concerns his belief that the job of the international organization was to inform member governments not how policy ought to be in terms of how much money they ought to put up, but how much in terms of additional funds they can effectively use.
